TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Ashy-skeletal, glassy, frigid Humic Udivitrands

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Edgewood gravelly ashy loamy coarse sand - under white fir/snowbrush ceanothus-prostrate ceanothus/Virginia strawberry plant association, woodland, on a 30 percent slope with west aspect at 5530 feet elevation. (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise noted.)
Oi--0 to 1 inch; slightly decomposed plant material; forest litter of needles, twigs, cones and leaves; abrupt smooth boundary.  (0 to 2 inches thick)
Oe--1 to 2 inches; moderately decomposed plant material; forest litter of needles, twigs, cones and leaves; abrupt smooth boundary.  (0 to 2 inches thick)
A1--2 to 7 inches; very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) gravelly ashy loamy coarse sand, dark brown (10YR 3/3) dry; single grain; loose, nonsticky, nonplastic; few fine and coarse, common medium and many very fine roots; many very fine interstitial pores; 20 percent indurated volcanic rock gravel, 5 percent indurated volcanic rock cobbles, 2 percent indurated volcanic rock stones, 1 percent indurated volcanic rock boulders and 2 percent moderately cemented pumice paragravel; slightly acid (pH 6.4); clear wavy boundary.  (2 to 10 inches thick)
A2--7 to 19 inches; dark brown (10YR 3/3) cobbly ashy coarse sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) dry; weak medium subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; common fine and  medium, few coarse and many very fine roots; many fine and very fine irregular pores; 15 percent indurated volcanic rock gravel, 10 percent indurated volcanic rock cobbles, 5 percent indurated volcanic rock stones, 1 percent indurated volcanic rock boulders and 2 percent moderately cemented pumice paragravel; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual smooth boundary.  (0 to 14 inches thick)
Bw1--19 to 39 inches; brown (7.5YR 4/3) extremely stony ashy loamy coarse sand, brown (7.5YR 5/4) dry; single grain; loose, nonsticky, nonplastic; common fine and coarse, many very fine and medium, and few very coarse roots; many very fine interstitial pores; 20 percent indurated volcanic rock gravel, 30 percent indurated volcanic rock cobbles, 25 percent indurated volcanic rock stones and 1 percent moderately cemented pumice paragravel and ; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear wavy boundary.  (6 to 32 inches thick)
2Bw2--39 to 61 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) very cobbly ashy sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) dry; weak fine subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few fine, medium and coarse and many very fine roots; many very fine irregular pores; 15 percent indurated volcanic rock gravel, 20 percent indurated volcanic rock cobbles and 2 percent indurated volcanic rock stones; slightly acid (pH 6.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Klamath County, Oregon; about 12 miles north and 3 miles east of Klamath Falls; 800 feet east and 100 feet south of the northwest corner of section 35, T. 36 S., R. 8 E.,  Swan Lake Point, Oregon USGS quadrangle.  UTM:  603882 meters E; 4696339 meters N; Zone 10 N. NAD27 CONUS datum.  Latitude:  42 degrees 24 minutes 52.00 seconds north, Longitude:  121 degrees 44 minutes 15.00 seconds west.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature - 42 to 45 degrees
Soil Moisture: udic regime. Moisture control section - 8 to 24 inches, dry in all parts for 30 to 45 consecutive days in August, September or October
Diagnostic horizons and features
Mollic epipedon:  10 to 20 inches thick
Andic soil properties: from the mineral soil surface to the 2Bw horizon, 24 to 40 inches thick
Volcanic glass content:  30 to 70 percent
Ammonium oxalate extractable Al+1/2Fe: 0.4 to 1.0
Phosphate retention: 25 to 50 percent
15 bar water content on dried samples: 7 to 12 percent
Particle-size control section: from the mineral soil surface to 40 inches
Glass content: 30 to 70 percent throughout
A1 horizon
Hue:  7.5YR or 10YR moist or dry
Value:  2 to 3 moist, 3 or 4 dry
Chroma:  2 or 3 dry
Paragravel content:  0 to 5 percent
Gravel content:  15 to 35 percent
Cobble content:  0 to 5 percent
Stone content:  0 to 5 percent
Boulder content:  0 to 5 percent
Reaction:  strongly acid to slightly acid (pH 5.1 to 6.5)
A2 horizon
Hue:  7.5YR or 10YR moist or dry
Value:  2 to 3 moist, 4 or 5 dry
Chroma:  2 or 3 moist
Texture:  ashy coarse sandy loam, gravelly ashy coarse sandy loam, cobbly ashy coarse sandy loam
Paragravel content:  0 to 5 percent
Gravel content:  0 to 20 percent
Cobble content:  0 to 15 percent
Stone content:  0 to 5 percent
Boulder content:  0 to 5 percent
Reaction:  slightly acid or neutral (pH 6.1 to 7.3)
Bw1 horizon
Depth to:  10 to 20 inches
Hue:  7.5YR or 10YR moist or dry
Value:  3 or 4 moist, 4 or 5 dry
Chroma:  3 or 4 moist or dry
Texture:  extremely cobbly ashy loamy coarse sand, extremely stony ashy loamy coarse sand, extremely cobbly ashy coarse sandy loam, extremely stony ashy coarse sandy loam
Paragravel content:  0 to 5 percent
Gravel content:  5 to 20 percent
Cobble content:  10 to 45 percent
Stone content:  10 to 35 percent
Boulder content:  0 to 10 percent
Reaction:  slightly acid or neutral (pH 6.1 to 7.3)
2Bw2 horizon
Depth to:  24 to 40 inches
Hue:  7.5YR or 10YR moist or dry
Value:  3 or 4 moist, 4 or 5 dry
Chroma:  2 or 3 moist, 3 or 4 dry
Texture:  very gravelly ashy sandy loam, extremely gravelly ashy sandy loam, very cobbly ashy sandy loam, extremely cobbly ashy sandy loam
Gravel content:  15 to 50 percent
Cobble content:  10 to 40 percent
Stone content:  0 to 15 percent
Boulder content:  0 to 15 percent
Volcanic glass content:  30 to 70 percent
Ammonium oxalate extractable Al plus 1/2 Fe:  0.2 to 0.4 percent
Phosphate retention:  10 to 25 percent
Reaction:  slightly acid or neutral (pH 6.1 to 7.3)

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  Ther are no competing series.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landscape - mountains
Landform - creeps mantling cirques, dipslopes, scarp slopes and stratovolcanos
Elevation - 4,590 to 7,250 feet
Slope - 2 to 50 percent
Parent material - colluvium derived from volcanic rock and tephra
Climate - cold moist winters, cool dry summers
Mean annual air temperature - 40 to 45 degrees F
Mean annual precipitation - 20 to 44 inches
Frost-free period - 50 to 90 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Ryespur and Yawhee soils.  Ryespur soils have an argillic horizon, a xeric soil moisture regime and lack andic soil properties.  Yawhee soils have an argillic horizon.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:
Drainage - somewhat excessively
Permeability - moderately rapid

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Edgewood soils are used for timber production, wildlife habitat, watershed and recreation.  The potential natural plant community is the white fir/snowbrush ceanothus-prostrate ceanothus/Virginia strawberry plant association.  Common overstory species include Douglas-fir, incense cedar, ponderosa pine, sugar pine and white fir.  Common understory species include greenleaf manzanita, creeping snowberry, snowbrush ceanothus, prostrate ceanothus and long-stolon sedge.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Klamath County, Oregon; MLRA 3.  Series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED:  Winema National Forest, Klamath County, Oregon, 2008

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and features
Mollic epipedon - 2 to 19 inches (A1 and A2 horizons)
Andic soil properties - 2 to 39 inches (A1, A2 and Bw1 horizons)
Cambic horizon - 19 to 61 inches (Bw1 and 2Bw2 horizons)
Particle-size control section - 2 to 42 inches (A1, A2, Bw1 and portion of 2Bw2 horizons)
Need to check on amorphic vs. glassy, default is to go amorphic on udic soils
